intro: Lactuca integra, commonly known as the common endive, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its curly, leafy foliage and is often cultivated for its edible leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces yellow flowers in the summer. Its leaves are used in various culinary applications, including salads and cooked dishes. Lactuca integra is native to Europe and parts of Asia but is now grown in many regions worldwide.
